message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.MM

The paper deals with the problem of recommending and ranking user-generated content on a participatory media platform, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) techniques. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are the most likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of NLP for topic modeling and sentiment analysis, which falls under cs.CL (Computation and Language). The platform also plays audio messages, which could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses the application of the model to other participatory media platforms, which could fall under cs.CY (Computers and Society).
